summary.body: I are aware of the latest postings on barbican talk with links to adult content.  The links to one of the sites requests a download of windows media player. I would strongly advise against downloading anything from this link unless you trust the source completely. It would seem, in the first instance that no laws have been broken as the actual content is not posted on the site, only a link which the viewer has the choice to click on or not. However, we will look into the matter and fully support any prosecution / action should any offences be discovered and an official complaint recieved. Yours Paul Gilmour
summary.subject: Adult content postings

summary.body: advice and thoughts on the following appreciated ... I received a letter today from S Waters in the Estate Office threatening me with legal action if I didn't pay the roof works bill for Bunyan ... but there are still outstanding snagging issues which are acknowledged by the City of London and the whole roof works process has been a long tale of woe ... so is it legal to threaten legal action requiring payment for a piece of work that i would argue is not complete and so, in effect, the service has not been rendered?   I have to confess to a slight degree of incredulity at the letter beause earlier this week i also received a note from our (nice) new House Officer asking me and other residents to send an updated list of snagging items ... characterising perfectly for me the lack of real customer focus that bedevils such operations in our local authority ...
summary.subject: legitimacy of billing for services not rendered
